title: Cheap metal id tags?
content:
Can anyone think off hand where you can get metal id tags made cheap. I know petco does pet ones, but they’re like $8 a piece.

What about the ones you see on trees and stuff?

 [‹ Fresh or classic? Newspaper fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212536/http:/typophile.com/node/39570 "Go to previous forum topic") [Box Drawing glyphs - yet another obscure topic ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212536/http:/typophile.com/node/38717 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fredcastle

comments.content:
I believe if you join the army you get them for free :-)

Sets of punches are available on ebay...

[http://search.ebay.com/search/search.dll?from=R40&\_trksid=m37&satitle=le...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212536/http:/search.ebay.com/search/search.dll?from=R40&_trksid=m37&satitle=letter+punches&category0= "http://search.ebay.com/search/search.dll?from=R40&\_trksid=m37&satitle=letter+punches&category0=")

...these would let you make your own using recycled tin-cans - or use these

[http://search.ebay.com/search/search.dll?sofocus=bs&sbrftog=1&catref=C6&...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212536/http:/search.ebay.com/search/search.dll?sofocus=bs&sbrftog=1&catref=C6&from=R10&_trksid=m37&satitle=blank+dogtags+&sacat=-1%26catref%3DC6&sargn=-1%26saslc%3D2&sadis=200&fpos=98118&sabfmts=1&saobfmts=insif&ftrt=1&ftrv=1&saprclo=&saprchi=&fsop=1&fsoo=1 "http://search.ebay.com/search/search.dll?sofocus=bs&sbrftog=1&catref=C6&from=R10&\_trksid=m37&satitle=blank+dogtags+&sacat=-1%26catref%3DC6&sargn=-1%26saslc%3D2&sadis=200&fpos=98118&sabfmts=1&saobfmts=insif&ftrt=1&ftrv=1&saprclo=&saprchi=&fsop=1&fsoo=1")

One of the gift shops at the National Museum of American History has authentic WWII dogs tags which they personalize, and I seem to recall they were around $5 each. Unfortunately, the museum is closed until next summer, and this particular item doesn’t seem to be available in the online Smithsonian shop...

Don’t tell anyone, but I was in a Wal-Mart the other day (I didn’t buy anything...I swear!) and happened to see a ’child ID’ vending machine that appeared to make dog tags.

Otherwise, walk down to the local National Guard Armory and ask if they’d make you a bunch.
